result.reason: Options Theme page does not apply dark theme colors to its child controls (combobox, buttons, labels, listview), resulting in white backgrounds in dark themes like vs2015dark.
result.approach: Override ApplyTheme in ThemePage to propagate theme colors to child controls (cboTheme, btnThemeNew, btnThemeDelete, labelRestart, listPalette) using ExtendedPalette colors, matching the pattern used in other themed forms.

attempts.raw_output:
The issue is clear - the Options Theme page doesn't properly apply dark theme colors to its own controls (background remains white in vs2015dark). The base `ApplyTheme` only sets `BackColor`/`ForeColor` on the page itself but doesn't propagate to child controls like the combo box, buttons, labels, and the palette list.

```json
{"decision":"implement","reason":"Options Theme page does not apply dark theme colors to its child controls (combobox, buttons, labels, listview), resulting in white backgrounds in dark themes like vs2015dark.","priority":"P3-enhancement","estimated_files":["mRemoteNG/UI/Forms/OptionsPages/ThemePage.cs","mRemoteNG/UI/Forms/OptionsPages/OptionsPage.cs"],"approach":"Override ApplyTheme in ThemePage to propagate theme colors to child controls (cboTheme, btnThemeNew, btnThemeDelete, labelRestart, listPalette) using ExtendedPalette colors, matching the pattern used in other themed forms."}
```
